Expected result: The Welcome Back screen is shown.
The Ether balance is shown on the overview. The wallet address is shown on the overview. The selected network is Ethereum Mainnet.

Test steps: Keep the selected network as Ethereum Mainnet. Click "Swap" button on MetaMask home screen.
Preconditions: Have funds on mainnet. (We can only test smart swap with real money on Ethereum Mainnet)
Expected result: Swap screen is shown. Default swap from currency is ETH. Settings button is shown.

Test steps: Click on settings button on swap screen. Turn on the smart swap toggle in settings.
Preconditions: The smart swap toggle initially was set to OFF.
Expected result: Slippage tolerance section is displayed. User can choose between 2%, 3%, or enter a custom value.

Test steps: In custom field, enter a percentage equals or higher than 5%.
Expected result: High slippage warning message is shown.

Test steps: On swap screen, enter a value for ETH that user wants to swap, then select a token to swap to.
Test data: e.g.  0.1 ETH to swap, and choose DAI to swap to
Expected result: The amount for selected token user will obtain is displayed. Swap quote rate is shown. Estimated gas fee and max fee are shown. Included MetaMask fee is shown.
Notes: Take a note for the amount of selected token that user will obtain.

Expected result: High slippage warning notification is shown.
After processing, transaction complete screen is shown.

Test steps: Close the transaction complete screen. Go to tokens tab.
Expected result: The token we selected to swap to is displayed with the expected amount on tokens list.
Swap transaction appears in the activity list. The swapped amount is shown in the activity list item.
The status, recipient's address, nonce, amount, gas and total are shown in the item details.

Test steps: Expand the activity log for the transaction.
Expected result: The created, submitted and confirmed activities are shown in the activity log.

Test steps: Proceed to view the transaction on the block explorer.
Expected result: The block explorer opens in a new tab.
